Package com.dougnoel.sentinel.webdrivers

Class Driver

java.lang.Object
com.dougnoel.sentinel.webdrivers.Driver
public class Driver extends Object
Manages all drivers. Maintains as few drivers as possible for test execution. Currently we store one driver for browsers and one for Windows. We can add an appium driver here as well.

  • Constructor Details

    • Driver

      private Driver()
      Exists only to defeat instantiation.

  • Method Details

    • getSentinelDriver

      private static SentinelDriver getSentinelDriver()
      Returns the SentinelDriver instance. This will silently instantiate the WebDriver if that has not been done yet.
      Returns:
      SentinelDriver the created SentinelDriver

    • getWebDriver

      public static org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver getWebDriver()
      Returns the WebDriver instance. This will silently instantiate the WebDriver if that has not been done yet.
      Returns:
      WebDriver the created Selenium WebDriver object

    • quitAllDrivers

      public static void quitAllDrivers()
      Quits all drivers and removes them from the list of active drivers.

    • closeWindow

      public static void closeWindow()
      Closes the current window and moves the driver to the previous window.

    • goToNextWindow

      public static void goToNextWindow()
      Asks the current driver to move forwards to the next window in the list. Use of this method assumes that the user knows the expected state of the software they are testing and will test to make sure they are in the correct window.

    • goToNewWindow

      public static void goToNewWindow()
      Asks the current driver to wait for, and move forwards to, the next new window in the list.

      Use of this method assumes:
      That the user knows the expected state of the software they are testing, and will test to make sure they are in the correct window.

    • goToTitledWindow

      public static void goToTitledWindow(String title)
      Sets the window that the driver will be using by handle/title

    • doesWindowExist

      public static boolean doesWindowExist(String title)
      Checks if a window is found within the session
      Parameters:
      title - String the title of the window to check for
      Returns:
      true if the window is found, false if not

    • goToPreviousWindow

      public static void goToPreviousWindow()
      Asks the current driver to move backwards to the previous window in the list. Use of this method assumes that the user knows the expected state of the software they are testing and will test to make sure they are in the correct window.

    • navigateForward

      public static void navigateForward()
      Asks the current driver to emulate clicking the browser's forward button.

    • navigateBack

      public static void navigateBack()
      Asks the current driver to emulate clicking the browser's back button.

    • refresh

      public static void refresh()
      Asks the current driver to emulate clicking the browser's refresh button.

    • maximizeWindow

      public static void maximizeWindow()
      Maximizes the browser window.

    • getCurrentUrl

      public static String getCurrentUrl()
      Returns the URL of the current page.
      Returns:
      String current active window/tab's url

    • getTitle

      public static String getTitle()
      Returns the title of the current tab
      Returns:
      String the title of the currently active tab/window
